definition: to rule/to govern/to manage/to control/to harness (a river)/to treat (a disease)/to wipe out (a pest)/to punish/to research

sentences.english: The other was “Hong Kong people ruling Hong Kong”.
Relying on moral self-discipline excessively is an obvious characteristic of rule by man.
sentences.chinese: 过于依赖道德，囿于自律，是人治的突出特征。

sentences.english: He is like Gulliver at Liliput overwhelmed by an enormous number of a little men.
sentences.chinese: 他会象格列弗在里里普特那样，被无数矮小的人治服。

sentences.english: Rule by man is the least tolerant, and even it is not tolerant at all.
sentences.chinese: 人治的宽容度最小，甚至不具有宽容性。

sentences.english: It is an important step to replace the rule of men with the rule of law in China’s justice reforms.
sentences.chinese: 以法治代替人治是中国司法改革的重要一步。

definition: rule by virtue/rule by setting virtuous example (Confucian ideal)
rule of law/to rule by law
to rule/to govern/to manage/to control/to harness (a river)/to treat (a disease)/to wipe out (a pest)/to punish/to research
centralized power (history), e.g. under an Emperor or party

Legalist School of the Warring States Period (475-221 BC) founded by Han Fei 韓非|韩非[Han2 Fei1] and Li Si 李斯[Li3 Si1], later adopted by Shang Yang 商鞅[Shang1 Yang1] whose reforms helped establish the supremacy of the Qin Dynasty 秦代[Qin1 dai4] (221-207 BC)
to enlighten/to civilize/to indoctrinate/to train (an animal)
ignorant masses/to keep the people in ignorance
